div1.head:
Richmond Dispatch
by Cowardin & Hammersley.
div1.p:
the Daily Dispatch is served to subscribers at six and A Quarter Cents Per week, payable to the Carrier weekly.
Price for mailing, $4 a year, or $2.50 for six months, in advance.
the Semi-Weekly Dispatch is issued every Tuesday and Friday at $2.00, in advance.
the Weekly Dispatch is issued every Friday, and mailed to subscribers at $1 per annum.
Advertisements published until forbid, will be charged 50 cents per square of eight lines for the first insertion, and 25 cents for each continuance

Two horse Wagons.
50 sets Wagon Harness.
sets Artillery Harness.

10,000 Tin Plates.

Chief of Ord of Va., at Lynchburg

Ord Dep. Va.
cor. 7th and Cary sts, Richm'd.
Next.--Prom parties who may be unable to the whole number of any of the articles above mat ed, such portions as they can supper will be received je 12--ts

div3.head: $100 reward
div3.p:
--I will give the above reward for the delivery of the following and persons, or $25 for each of them, at the any of the 18th Mississippi regiment.
They have deserted their colors:

div4.head: Framer and Description.
div4.p: Robt. C. Wallace, about 5 feet 8 or 9 inches high; sandy hair; fair complexion; blue eyes, and by occupation, when enlisted, a teacher.
Ben. P. Smith. about 5 feet 6 inches high; heavily proportioned; black hair; black eyes; dark complexion, and when enlisted an overseen.
Wm. Hamlin, about 5 feet 8 inches high; dark complexion, light hair; hazel eyes, and by occupation when enlisted, a farmer

Geo. A. Leak. about 5 feet 9 inches high; fairly proportioned; light hair, and partially bald; hazel eyes; fair complexion; he has a smooth speech and four address.
He has been representing that the holds a commission to raise a guerrilla company.
When last heard from he was connected with Capt. Horace Balfour's guards company.

All the above-named individuate are now berthed to be with this (Balfour's) company-- Wallace perhaps holding a commission as 3d Lieutenant They have deserted in the immediate presence of the enemy, and their apprehension and delivery is not earnestly desired.
div4.closer:
J. M. Adams,
12--3t* Capt. Co. G. 18th Reg't Miss. Vols.

div3.head: $75 reward.
div3.p: --I will give the above reward for the apprehension and delivery of the following named persons, or $25 of them to me at the Camp of the Mississippi regiment, they having deserted their colors, viz:

W. R. Croxton, a Virginian by birth, about 50 years of age, fair complexion, blue gray eyes, light hair, about 5 feet 11 inches high.
He deserted his company at Price's farm.

Also, John Ryan, claiming to be an un raltred Irishman, about 26 or 27 years old, fair skin, blue eyes, dark hair, about 5 feet 9 or 10 inches high.
He deserted his company whilst on the Peninsula.

And A. Friedlander, a German Jew, about 23 years of age. dark skin, hair and eyes 5 feet 7 inches high.
He deserted his company at Grove's Landing.
div3.closer:
F. Bostick,
je 12--3t* Capt. Co. D, 18th Miss. Reg't.

div3.head: $100 reward.
div3.p: --I will give the above reward for the apprehension and delivery to me, at the camp of the 18th Mississippi regiment, the following named persons, they having deserted their colors in the face of the enemy — viz:
H. Miller a German Jew, about 22 years of age, 5 feet 4 inches high, dark complexion, dark hair and eyes, and by occupation (when enlisted) a tailor.
Also, A. M. Styles, a Northerner, 5 feet 8 inches high, fair complexion, light hair and blue eyes, and by occupation (when enlisted) a brick mason.
Also, N. J. Careky, a native of Ireland, about 20 years old, 5 feet 5 inches high, light hair and complexion, gray eyes, and by occupation (when enlisted) a clerk.
Also, George Swregatt, a foreigner, 6 feet high, might hair and complexion, very stout built, and by occupation (when enlisted) a blacksmith.
div3.closer:
W. H. Lewis,
je 12--3t* Capt. Co. E, 18th Miss. Reg.

div3.head:
Headq'rs 14th Reg't Va. Vols.,
June 11, 1862.
div3.p: the following members of my company are absent without leave, and unless they report themselves to camp, four miles below Richmond, on the York River Railroad, immediately, will be advertised as deserters, and the regal reward of $30 paid for their recovery.

Corp'l C. H. Nunnally, Corp'l Edw'd Peel, Privates Andrew Pride, Frank Hughes, Wm. Young Jacob W. Todd, Wm. Bradford, B. F. Rexms, John T. Watkins, Joseph Rollison, W. A. L. Beazley, Thomas Kenny, B. L. Jorest, Dennis Harrington, Andrew Jewist, Robert Prel, S. A. Coleman.
J. H. More.
div3.closer:
J. Poindexter, Capt.,
Company I, 14th Reg't Va. Vols.,
Four miles below Richmond,
je 12--3t* On the York River Railroad.

div3.head: $30 reward.
div3.p: --Will be paid for the apprehension and delivery to me, at ubt No. 5, near Fairfield Race Course, of each of the following deserters, viz:

Reward Brown, formerly a private of the 14th Louisiana regiment, deserted from camp on the 7th of June. Said Brown had sandy hair, and slight beard of the same color, blue eyes, long Roman nose, ruddy complexion, about 5 feet 10 inches high, and of Irish extraction.

Lewis Smith deserted May 28th, 1862--a substitute.
He claims to be a citizen of Maryland and a native of Ireland; square face, dark visaged, black eyes and hair, sin expression of countenance, and 5 feet 7 inches high.
He was dressed in citizen's clothier when he left.
je 12--3t*

div3.head: Notice.
div3.p: --The man named below, members of Company I, 45th Virginia Regiment, and of Companies G and D, at ached to Company I, are ordered to report immediately for duty at camp of 41th Regiment Virginia Volunteers, or be treated at deserters.
Company I.--W. Fulcher, M. H. Fitzpatrick, W. Simma, M. Glesson, D. H. Wheeler, Martin Wingfield, J. A. Henderson, R. Baber.

Company G.--John Dullins, G. W. Tomblic, W. O. Tomblin, H. L. Tomblin.
Spotswood Critter, Benj. Mayer, James Slaffer, Sam Baber, Naster Toms, Ed Kirby, W. Quicke, G. T. Fox.
Company D.--J. Shifflit, Chofman Shifflit, N. Lomb, Jos Boy. Montgomery Head, W. Cotterham.
div3.closer:
By order. Brig. Gen. H. A. Wise.
je 12--4t*

div3.head: $30 reward.
div3.p:
--I will pay the above reward for the arrest and delivery to the of Henry W. Morast, private of Loudoun Artillery, who left our camp, near Richmond, one week ago, riding a small light; mare, branded "C. S.," with one white kind foot and long bushy tail.
Said Morast ted in my battery from the State of Alabama, and is supposed to be lurking about Richmond or in the 5th regiment of Alabama volunteers.
He is about 5 feet 9 inches high, with light blue eyes, fair complexion, light hair, and prominent nose; is about 25 years of and well educated.
div3.closer:
Arth. L. Rogers,
Capt Com'ding Loudoun Artillery,
je 12--3t* Longstreet's Division.

div3.head:
Adj't General's Office of Va.,
June, 19, 1862.
div3.p: officers Recruiting for the Line of State Troops are Positively Forbid to enlist any deserter, stragglier from the Confederate service, or man from 18 to 35 years of age, who are subject to the Conscript law. They will report all such persons as may propose to enlist in the State service to the nearest officer of the Confederate army.
div3.closer:
By command:
Wm. H. Richardson, Adj't Gen.
je 12--3t

div3.head: Attention, 18th Virginia Regiment.
div3.p: All absentees from the 18th Regiment Virginia Volunteers who do not report in person at these headquarters within one week from date, or forward the certificate of some Army Surgeon, will be advertised as deserters, whether officers or men.
div3.closer:
R. E. Withers,
Colonel 18th Virginia Regiment.
June 12th, 1862. je 12--3t*

div3.head:
Ordnance Department of Va.,
Lynchburg, June 12, 1862.
div3.p: Notice — As all preparations for Major Gen'l Floyd's Army are being concentrated at Lynchburg, the issues from this Department will be there made.
Legislations must be first signed by Gen. Floyd some officer authorized by him, then approved by Adjutant General Wm. H. Richardson, at Richmond, upon which the issues will be made.
div3.closer:
C. Dimmock.
je 12-- Brig. Gen. Ordnance of Va.
Enquirer and Whig will copy.

div3.head: Notice.
div3.p:
--All persons belonging to the 18th Mississippi regiment, in or about Richmond, who are able to do duty, and who do not report for duty, shall be treated as deserters.
By order:
div3.closer:
Thomas M. Griffin,
Colonel 18th Miss. Regiment.
C. E. Stuart, Serg't Maj je 12--3t*

div3.head: Attention, light Artillery.
div3.p:
--I am authorized by the Governor to re Substitutes in my company of light Artillery, and to muster them in as they come.
Those, therefore, who desire to procure substitutes, or who wish to become substitutes, should call at once at my headquarters, Johnson & Guigon's office, under the Whig Building.
div3.closer:
A. B. Guigon,
21--1t Captain Light Artillery.

div3.p: $30 reward will be paid for the apprehension and delivery at the Quartermaster's Office, 115 Broad street, or at the Marine Camp, near Drury's Bluff, of any one of the following-described deserters from the Marine Corps:
Corporal Richard McGREGOR, aged 23, 5 feet 10½ inches high, blue eyes, brown hair, fresh complexion.
Private Theodore Davis, aged 25, 5 feet 9 inches high, blue eyes, black hair, florid complexion.
Private Patrick, Lowney, aged 24, 5 feet 9½ inches high, hazel eyes, auburn hair, fair complexion.
Private Wm. H. Brewsher, aged 23, 5 feet 6½ inches high, hazel eyes, light brown hair, dark complexion.
Private Peter Marry, aged 33, 5 feet 6 inches high, hazel eyes, dark hair, dark complexion.
Private Thos. Marry, aged 24, 5 feet 6 inches high, blue eyes, light hair, light complexion.
Private Thos. Crilby, aged 33, 5 feet 5½ inches high, hazel eyes, dark hair, dark complexion.
Private William Shannon, aged 27, 5 feet 5½ inches high, blue eyes, auburn hair, dark complexion.
Private Edwin Ford, aged 23, 5 feet 7 inches high, black eyes, dark hair, dark complexion.
Private Jas. Leahy, aged 23, 5 feet 5 inches high, blue eyes, sandy hair, fair complexion.
Private Daniel Moriarty, aged 23, 5 feet 9 inches high, blue eyes, light hair, light complexion.
Private Kieran Mullen, aged 25, 5 feet 9½ inches high, gray eyes, light hair, light complexion.
Private Geo. Emerson, aged 19, 5 feet 4½ inches high, gray eyes, light hair, florid complexion.
Private Lewis Perres, aged 32, 5 feet 10 inches high, gray eyes, brown hair, light complexion.
Private Lewisle Faiver, aged 32, 5 feet 7 inches high, hazel eyes, brown hair, dark complexion.
The attention of recruiting officers is particularly called to the above advertisement, as it is suspected these men will re-enlist for the benefit of the bounty as often as they can do so.
div3.closer:
A. S. Taylor,
je 11--6t Maj. and Quar'r, C. S. M. C.
Petersburg Express copy for one week, and send bill to this Department.

div3.head: $50 reward.
div3.p:
--Francis Thomas Duffy, a member of my company, absented himself from my camp on Saturday last, and carried with him a bay Mare belonging to my battery.
I will pay a reasonable reward for the return of the Mare, and fifty dollars reward for the apprehension and delivery to me of Duffy, at my camp, near Mechanicsville Bridge.

Duffy is 24 years of age, 5 feet 11½ inches high, has brown hair, blue eyes, full face, sharp nose, ruddy complexion, and has a small scar on the forehead.
He sometime passes under the name of Francis Thomas.
The Mare is a light-colored bay, with one white hind foot, and a star in the forehead, is branded C. S., but the letters are very indistinct.
div3.closer:
Greenlee Davidson,
je 11--3t* Captain Letcher Artillery

div3.head:
City Battalion--
Maj. W. M. Elliott.
Commd'g pay $31 Per Month, and rations.
div3.p:
one hundred men Wanted, between the ages of 16 and 45, for a company in the above Battalion, for local and special defence of the city of Richmond or Manchester.
for a term of six months unless sooner discharged by order of the Secretary of War.

None but men of good character will be received.
Apply, between the hours of 9 A. M. and 2 P. M. to
div3.closer:
W. W. Harrison,
At Ragland & Bro.'s, cor. 9th and Main sts.
Geo. Baughman,
W. H. Allison,
121 Main street,
John M. West,
